products.title: GG Brew Methods Tote Bag
products.body_html: Rep your favorite coffee roaster with our new Brew Methods Tote Bag. Made for carrying your beans, gear, or daily essentials, this bag stylishly displays various brew methods that make your perfect cup of coffee a reality.

products.title: Lunar New Year Artist Collaboration Bundle - 2025
products.body_html:
The coffee:  Our beautiful black honey processed Robusta, Lam Dong, is the main character for our Lunar New Year Blend. This coffee provides deep layers of chocolate covered raisins, hints of sweet kettle corn, and rich molasses body that is characteristic of Fine Vietnamese robusta coffees. Known for their unique flavor and higher caffeine content, the Robusta offers bold notes of dark chocolate, toasted nuts, and a hint of molasses. 

The other two complimenting coffees that make up our Lunar New Year 2025 blend are both grown in the Central Highlands of Vietnam. These two washed processed arabicas add a smooth and a subtle sweetness with some high notes of Umeboshi to the blend. This coffee trio lends a lively and harmonious cup profile and offers an inviting complexity without overwhelming that delicate balance.

The cup: This year’s Limited Edition LNY artist collaboration features Jung Kwak’s beautiful wheel thrown ceramic mugs. They’re available in two color options. Each cup is made by hand and unique, so there will be subtle differences from the photographed piece. The cups hold 12 oz of coffee

They are all handmade, wheel thrown, and fired in an electric kiln at cone 6 (midfire)

The black, speckled and porcelain cups are comprised of three different clays which create a marbled effect when they are thrown on the wheel. The inside is finished with a clear gloss glaze to highlight the speckling. 

The same method is used for the red, speckled, and porcelain cups. The inside of the cups are glazed in an alabaster satin glaze. 

All cups are food-safe, and are dishwasher and microwave-safe. Handwashing is recommended to prolong the life of the cups. 

Since these cups are wheel-thrown using a marbling technique, no two cups are alike. 

The artist: Jung Kwak - @Logan_ceramics 

“I grew up surrounded by art, and some of my fondest memories are of my father’s oil paintings that adorned every inch of our small family apartment in Queens, NY. Watching him paint taught me how he intuitively guided his brush strokes, seeking harmony and balance in composition, form, and color. 

By chance, I stumbled into pottery after spending over 25 years in graphic design. 

I felt a strong desire to create tangible works with my hands. 

My vessels reflect a blend of classical forms and modern influences. Just as the unique characteristics of wood grain tell a story, I explore texture and marbling techniques to create a distinct tactile language in clay. My hope is that these vessels will be cherished over time and offer comfort in your everyday life.”

products.title: Coffees from Asia: Kyauk Ku Pyin, Loc Rung, & Lunar New Year Blend
products.body_html:
Limited Time Offering: Bundle of 3!

Embark on a flavor adventure this Lunar New Year with our specially curated bundle of 3-4 oz coffees from various regions of Asia! 🌏🐉 Celebrate the Year of the Snake by savoring the unique tastes and aromas of our handpicked selection.

Loc Rung - Vietnam:

This coffee showcases the "fully washed" process, which removes the mucilage layer surrounding the coffee beans. This way, the beans don't ferment during drying, allowing them to express their full flavor potential. As a result, you can clearly taste the unique characteristics of the region, variety, and type of coffee you're enjoying, savoring its purest form! Indulge in flavors of honeydew, yellow peach, & banana curd.

Kyauk Ku Pyin - Myanmar:

This exceptional coffee showcases a vibrant, citric brightness and a clarity rarely found in natural coffees. Its remarkable cleanliness and distinct flavor profile make it a true standout in every cup. The farmers in Kyauk Ku Pyin are redefining what’s possible for coffee in Southeast Asia. This 100% Catuai variety is processed naturally—a sustainable approach that not only highlights the coffee’s unique flavors but also aligns with the region’s need to conserve water outside the rainy season. The result is extraordinary: a coffee offering sweetness, delicate floral notes, and an expressive complexity that lingers long after the last sip.

Prosperity Blend:

Our Lunar New Year Blend brings together three exceptional Vietnamese coffees, each with its own story, offering a full-bodied, harmonious cup that embodies the spirit of Vietnamese coffee culture. This blend kicks off our New Year’s resolution of featuring Asian coffees prominently in our lineup!

products.title: Prosperity Blend - Lunar New Year 2025
products.body_html:
Umeboshi, Chocolate Raisins, Toffee

Celebrate the start of a new year with a blend as vibrant and rich as the traditions it honors. Our Lunar New Year Blend brings together three exceptional Vietnamese coffees, each with its own story, offering a full-bodied, harmonious cup that embodies the spirit of Vietnamese coffee culture. This blend kicks off our New Year’s resolution of featuring Asian coffees prominently in our lineup!

 Our black honey processed robusta, Lam Dong, is the propelling engine of our Lunar New Year Blend. This coffee provides the deep, rich body that is characteristic of Vietnamese robusta coffees. Known for their unique flavor and higher caffeine content, the Robusta offers bold notes of dark chocolate, toasted nuts, and a hint of molasses. Their bitterness is perfect for balancing out the sweetness and complexity of its two Arabica counterparts.

The other two lots that make up this Vietnamese coffee trio are both grown in the highlands of Vietnam, these coffees add smoothness and a subtle sweetness to the blend. Expect delicate hints of caramel, brown sugar syrup, and chocolate, which round out the deeper flavors of the Robusta and bring balance to the cup. This gives the blend a bright, lively acidity that lifts the cup profile and offers an inviting complexity without overwhelming that delicate balance.

products.title: Kyauk Ku Pyin - Myanmar
products.body_html:
Ginger, Pineapple, Grape Compote

At Greater Goods, we’re thrilled to present our first coffee from Myanmar: the Kyauk Ku Pyin Natural. This exceptional coffee showcases a vibrant, citric brightness and a clarity rarely found in natural coffees. Its remarkable cleanliness and distinct flavor profile make it a true standout in every cup.

The farmers in Kyauk Ku Pyin are redefining what’s possible for coffee in Southeast Asia. This 100% Catuai variety is processed naturally—a sustainable approach that not only highlights the coffee’s unique flavors but also aligns with the region’s need to conserve water outside the rainy season. The result is extraordinary: a coffee offering sweetness, delicate floral notes, and an expressive complexity that lingers long after the last sip.

Details

Profile: Light

Producer: Various Smallholders

Region: Nwar Ban Gyi, Shan State

Process: Natural

Elevation: 1356 masl

Variety: Catuai

Source

The Kyauk Ku Pyin community, nestled in Myanmar’s Shan State, is home to over 400 Danu families who grow coffee at 1,356 masl. These families cultivate Catuai coffee on small plots, typically less than one hectare, using traditional agricultural knowledge passed down through generations.

Natural processing is the preferred method here, chosen for its sustainability in a region where water conservation is critical. This method not only produces vibrant, clean flavors but also aligns with the community’s commitment to sustainable practices.

Myanmar’s coffee journey is still emerging on the global stage, and Kyauk Ku Pyin is leading the charge. Through careful cultivation and processing, these farmers are redefining what Southeast Asian coffee can be.

Story

The Kyauk Ku Pyin coffee is a testament to resilience, hard work, and vision. In this community, coffee farming is a family effort, with 400 households working tirelessly to produce exceptional coffee. During harvest, cherries are hand-picked at peak ripeness, ensuring quality from the start.

One story that stands out is of a farmer who walked over 15 minutes with 110 pounds of perfectly ripe cherries on her back. Her dedication reflects the effort and pride this community pours into every bag of coffee.

Coffee production here isn’t just about economics—it’s about building a future. By embracing specialty coffee, the farmers of Kyauk Ku Pyin are transforming their livelihoods. Their journey showcases the potential of Myanmar as a coffee origin and highlights the unique flavors that emerge when passion meets opportunity.

We’re proud to share this remarkable coffee with you, a testament to the dedication and vision of the Kyauk Ku Pyin community.

products.title: Santa Rosa 1900 - Costa Rica
products.body_html:
Marzipan, White Grapefruit, Pink Champagne

Limited Time Offering  Santa Rosa 1900 is what we call "coffee magic" around here. It's an Ethiopian heirloom variety grown on Costa Rican soil, way up in the mountains (1900 meters above sea level, to be exact) of Tarrazú. From the moment we tasted it at the Santa Rosa mill, we knew we'd discovered something very special - and very atypical for Costa Rican coffees. Washed in traditional African style, this lactic and fruit-forward coffee reminds us of aromatic rosehips, creamy almond paste, and jammy raspberry preserves.  

Details

Profile Light-Medium
Producer Gelbert Naranjo
Region Tarrazú
Process Rested Red Honey
Elevation 1900 masl
Variety Catuai

Source

This was grown by the Naranjo family, a father and his two sons who've won several Cup of Excellence nods in Costa Rica in the last 13 years for their high-quality lots. Named after their world-renowned mill, Santa Rosa 1900 is an Ethiopian landrace variety called Ethiopia 47, a recent addition to the Costa Rica seed bank.

The rich Costa Rican soil, high elevation, and the Naranjo's meticulous processing techniques only enhance the variety's wild complexity. The coffee cherries are grown along a steep mountainside, de-pulped, and fermented in sealed Grainpro bags. Then, they are fully washed and laid to dry on raised African beds. 

We sourced this coffee during an origin trip to the region in February 2023. We were incredibly inspired by Kevin Naranjo (the youngest son) and his enthusiasm for this unique African/Costa Rican offering, the first of its kind for the family, but we were sold once we cupped it. Incredibly sweet, creamy, and fruity for a Costa Rica, this is our first purchase from the Santa Rosa mill, but certainly not our last.

products.title: Finca Kilimanjaro - El Salvador
products.body_html:
Pomelo, Jostaberry, Almond Roca

Limited Time Offering - For our first Limited Time Offering from El Salvador, we are releasing a real doozy. Aida Batlle, winner of the first Cup of Excellence competition in her home country, is a coffee legend for a reason. Finca Kilimanjaro is a master class in flavor clarity, complexity, and an unforgettable finish that will keep you brewing all day long. Grown at over 1700 meters above sea level up high in the mountains, Finca Kilimanjaro, a Bourbon varietal, was introduced to El Salvador over a century ago when it was brought from Guatemala by Aida Batlle's great-great-grandfather, who was the governor of Santa Ana Province. Aida Batlle has since elevated the quality of the coffee from her family's farm, gaining international recognition for her meticulous attention to detail in processing.

Details

Profile Light
Producer Aida Battle
Region Santa Ana
Process Washed
Elevation 1580-1720 masl
Varieties Bourbon

Source

Aida Batlle is a fifth-generation coffee producer operating her family’s three farms—Fincas Los Alpes, Kilimanjaro, and Mauritania—in El Salvador’s Santa Ana region. In 2003, Aida entered her first Cup of Excellence competition and won with Kilimanjaro; Los Alpes placed 16th. This washed bourbon is processed using only the ripest of cherries, Aida’s processing method for this coffee is quite unique. Once pulped the coffee undergoes two 24-hour fermentation processes. The first is a dry process, where the coffee sits in the fermentation tans sans water. At the 12-hour mark, the fermentation is interrupted, and the coffee is rinsed with a little freshwater and turned with a wooden paddle. It is then submerged in fresh water, spending a further 24 hours in an underwater fermentation, again washed every 12 hours. The coffee then goes back to the fermentation tank to soak in more freshwater for a final 24 hours before being placed on raised drying beds under shade cloth and polycarbonate roofing. It’s an intense process that leads to incredible flavors of stewed stone fruits and caramelized sugars and a delectably creamy texture.
tags: process:Natural / Hand-Sorted / Dried on raised beds

products.title: Holly Holiday Mug
products.body_html: Our 2025 limited edition Holly Mug (9 oz). Featuring our take on a Texas winter night. Grab yours before they're gone.

products.title: Cupping Kit
products.body_html:
Assess coffee like a pro with your very own at-home cupping kit. Cupping kit includes your very own set of cupping bowls (3), a Greater Goods branded cupping spoon (1)(choose between rose gold, purple, & blue, as well as a flavor wheel.  

What's included

3 cupping bowls
1 GG cupping spoon
Flavor wheel

products.title: Virtual Cupping
products.body_html:
To book for this event, please reach out to: training@ggroasting.com

Join us for a virtual cupping in the comfort of your own home! We'll ship you an At-Home Cupping Kit complete with a GG cupping spoon, three cupping bowls, three 4oz whole bean coffees, a flavor wheel, and a link to a Zoom meeting led by our coffee educator, Marcos.

Together, we’ll learn how to cup, compare tasting notes, and tell the stories behind our coffee and its components. This class is designed for folks of all sensory skill levels, from first-timers to seasoned professionals. You’ll leave the Zoom meeting caffeinated, empowered, and equipped with everything you need to cup coffee for the rest of time!

What's included

3 4oz whole bean coffees - Good Vibes, Fresh Perspective, Take Me Home
3 cupping bowls
1 GG cupping spoon
Flavor wheel + info cards
Zoom invitation
10% off your next coffee purchase

The fine print

To participate in this event, you are required to have at-home access to the following: internet, Zoom, hot water and kettle, scale, additional spoons, and a burr grinder. If you do NOT have a grinder, please be sure to select the "ground" option in the drop down menu above. 

Note* Bookings for couples will receive an additional cupping spoon.

Please triple check your shipping address during checkout! Greater Goods is not responsible for any lost packages. Virtual cupping kits are non-refundable. This event cannot be rescheduled. For questions, comments, or concerns, please contact us at training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Ribang Gayo - Sumatra
products.body_html:
Blue Raspberry, Pink Lemonade, Banana Pudding

Limited Time Offering - The coffee that won us a 2023 Good Food Award is back and even fruitier than we remember! Asman Arianto's specialty Sumatra reminds us of the sugary treats we loved when we were kids; think blue raspberry Jolly Rancher, pink Starburst, and a hint of Baja Blast. It's juicy and fruit-forward, with a sweet, banana pudding-like finish. Hailing from the Ribang Gayo Cooperative led by Asman Arianto, this coffee is a fantastic example of how high-quality processing methods can diversify flavors in the cup. 

Details

Profile Light - Medium
Producer Asman Arianto
Region Aceh Province
Process Natural
Elevation 1500-1700 masl
Varieties Abyssinia, Ateng, Tim Tim, Gayo 1, Gayo 2

Source

When Asman Arianto arrived in Aceh Tengah in 1998, he began collecting and processing wet-hulled (giling basah) coffee. This unique process is used almost exclusively in Sumatra, where many producers lack the drying infrastructure required to shelter parchment coffee from high humidity and inconsistent rainfall. Asman soon decided to transition to natural, washed, and honey processes with huge success. Ten years later, in 2018, he formed the Ribang Gayo Musara Cooperative with the goal to offer competitive prices and training for other farmers in the area. 

Today the cooperative is made up of over 350 producers who deliver hand-picked cherries to a newly completed wet mill in Pantan Musara. There the fruit goes through a rigorous selection process before being dried on raised beds in greenhouses.
tags: process:Natural / Hand-Sorted / Dried on raised beds

products.title: GG Brew Methods Tee
products.body_html: Rep your favorite coffee roaster while wearing their favorite brew methods (all of them). Sizing is unisex and runs a lil big.

products.title: Vietnam - Lộc Rừng
products.body_html:
Honeydew, Yellow peach, Banana Curd

Limited Time Offering -  

Greater Goods is excited to bring this exceptional coffee to our loyal customers, sharing the rich heritage and unique flavors of the Đưng K'nó area with coffee enthusiasts everywhere. Thank you for being a part of our journey and helping us share the true potential of Vietnamese coffee with the world!

Details

Profile: Light

Producer: Various Smallholders

Region: DungK'nớ, Central Highlands

Process: Fully Washed

Elevation: 1500-1850 masl

Variety: Catimor


Source

The Fully Washed flavor from the DungK'nớ region will bring you a unique experience. Unlike methods such as Honey, Natural, or Anaerobic Fermentation, which involve longer fermentation times during coffee bean drying—where the mucilage layer is still influenced by temperature and humidity, encouraging microorganisms to release enzymes that break down the mucilage layer and create more flavors in the coffee beans—the "Fully Washed" process removes the mucilage layer surrounding the coffee beans. This way, the beans don't ferment during drying, allowing them to express their full flavor potential. As a result, you can clearly taste the unique characteristics of the region, variety, and type of coffee you're enjoying, savoring its purest form!

Story

In the Chăm language, "K'ho" means "people of the mountains." These resilient folks have lived for thousands of generations under the gentle guardianship of the forests. The forest has taught them how to live, hunt, and gather, and they know every stream, tree, and animal like an old friend. As long as the forest and the people thrive, they cherish and protect the heritage and resources given to them by nature. Among these treasures are the coffee trees, which hold a special place in their hearts.

‘At Lộc Rừng, we are committed to three goals: "Protect the forest, help people, and make great coffee." This philosophy ensures a healthy coffee-growing region, improves the well-being of local people, and enhances the value of coffee in terms of flavor and quality in the Đưng K'nó area. We strive to make every cup of coffee filled with the rich heritage and vibrant flavors of our region.’

products.title: Colombia - Finca Las Juntas
products.body_html:
Starfruit, Gooseberry, Valencia Orange


Limited Time Offering - The Greater Goods team is thrilled about our collaboration from the southern region of Huila, Colombia. Partnering with Yamile Muñoz, we're excited to share with you a taste of the unique flavors and heritage from her farm.

One of the gems from Yamile's farm is the Pink Bourbon varietal, cherished for its rare pinkish cherries and exceptional flavor profile. When you savor this coffee, think of the bright and refreshing notes of star fruit, gooseberry, and Valencia orange. These flavors capture the essence of Huila's vibrant terroir and Yamile's dedication to producing exceptional coffee.

Join us in exploring the unique flavors of this collaboration from Huila's southern region!


Details


Profile: Light

Producer: Yamile Muñoz

Region: San Agustin, Huila

Process: Washed

Elevation: 1800 masl

Variety: Pink Bourbon


Source

In the southern region of Huila, Colombia, nestled high in the mountains with a breathtaking view of the Magdalena River, lies the charming municipality of San Agustín. This area is rich in cultural heritage, home to the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Archaeological Park, which spans 116 hectares. It is in this picturesque and historically significant locale that we find Yamile Muñoz and her farm, Finca Las Juntas.


Story

The farm has been a family legacy, initially owned by Yamile's grandfather and gradually acquired by her father. Yamile spent her childhood on this farm, but like many, she looked for better opportunities and moved to Bogotá, Colombia's bustling capital. However, the call of her roots and the desire to raise her child in the peaceful countryside drew her back to San Agustín nearly seven years ago.

This return marked a pivotal moment in Yamile's life. Teaming up with her mother, she decided to dive into coffee farming. Initially, their efforts focused on commercial-grade coffee. However, two and a half years ago, inspired by the potential of specialty coffee, Yamile and her mother made the significant decision to transition to producing specialty coffee. This shift presented numerous challenges, demanding hard work and meticulous attention to detail, but it also brought rewarding improvements in their income and quality of life.

Yamile extends a heartfelt invitation to visit their farm and the beautiful town of San Agustín. She shares, "Our coffee is carefully nurtured by women's hands, and we always strive to produce the best coffee possible for you to enjoy. We are committed to continuous improvement, investing in our farm, and making our coffee and San Agustín recognized worldwide."

products.title: Spark - Mexico
products.body_html:
Candied Apricot, Praline, Ganache

Women Producers  Get inspired and spark joy with this silky smooth single-origin coffee from Mexico! The unmistakable aroma of sweet, caramelized almonds will wake your taste buds to a vibrant candied apricot acidity and a satisfying ganache-like richness. Grown by the legendary Mayan Harvest group, Spark will ignite your senses and get your creative side firing on all cylinders. 

Details

Profile Medium
Producer Rosalba Cifuentes Tovia
Region Bella Vista, Chiapas
Process Washed
Elevation 1500-1650 masl
Variety Bourbon, Caturra, Catimor

Source

We feel fortunate to work directly with Rosalba Cifuentes Tovia, the renowned farmer, exporter, and importer behind Mayan Harvest. Raised in the famous coffee-growing community of Bella Vista, Chiapas, Rosalba has dedicated herself to helping producers with small plots (averaging five acres) earn a better price for their coffee. She ensures traceability by personally exporting the coffee from Mexico to the Bay Area, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to fair wages for farmers. 

Spark was grown by 38 family-owned farms within the municipality of Bella Vista, Chiapas, Mexico. Cherries were collected at peak ripeness and fully washed. This coffee supports the International Women's Coffee Alliance (IWCA). IWCA's mission is to unite a global network of chapters and support the work and growth of women in the international coffee community.

products.title: Limited Series: Cupping
products.body_html:
Explore our Limited Time Offerings! You'll try multiple unique coffees side by side and learn variations by origin, process, and roast profile. Using the official coffee flavor wheel and an accessible cupping guide, you’ll identify tasting notes and distinguish differences in aroma, body, sweetness, and acidity. 

Includes 10% off retail bagged coffee. Limit 6 students per session.

Duration: 1 hour
Location: DRIPPING SPRINGS

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, additional dates and private classes, contact training@ggroasting.com.

NOTE: This class is held in-person at our Dripping Springs Roastery. Public health and safety practices are carefully considered to allow participants to taste with reduced risk of cross-contamination. If you are experiencing any symptoms of COVID-19, please do not attend. By registering for this course, you are acknowledging all risk involved.

products.title: Pour Over Workshop
products.body_html:
Deep dive into the world of manual coffee brewing in this interactive class with our expert brewers. We'll choose one coffee from our lineup, then brew it four different ways using the V60. Discover how a small difference in grind size, water quality, brewing ratio, and much more can make a huge difference in the taste of your coffee, transferable to all sorts of brew methods out there!

This class is designed for the beginner home brewer. Limit 4 students per class.

Includes 4oz bag of coffee and 10% off brewing equipment.

Duration: 1.5 hours
Location: DRIPPING SPRINGS

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, additional dates and private classes, contact training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Miir Seed to Cup Origin Tumbler
products.body_html: The tumbler: These 12oz tumblers are perfect for chilly morning hand warming (as well as sipping). We were excited to get our tumblers from Miir, who is also a supporter of IWCA! We partnered with a local artist, to illustrate the stages coffee goes through before it gets to your cup!

products.title: Intermediate Espresso
products.body_html:
Do the words “extraction theory” excite you? US TOO! In this class, you'll dive deeper into espresso with our expert trainer, Marcos. We'll select a single-origin coffee to brew as espresso, dial in, and experiment with temperature and puck preparation to manipulate flavors and strength. This class is designed for the intermediate-advanced home barista. 

Intro to Espresso is a prerequisite. Limit 4 students per class.

Duration: 2 hours
Location: Dripping Springs

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, contact training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Public Cupping
products.body_html:
Explore the complexity, diversity, and pure unadulterated JOY of specialty coffee in this interactive tasting at Greater Goods! Together we'll brew 8 different coffees with an accessible and demystified cupping protocol, paying close attention to sensory aspects like aroma, body, sweetness, and acidity. By the end you'll feel caffeinated and confident when it comes to selecting your next bag of beans for home brewing.

Includes 10% off retail bagged coffee. Limit 6 students per session.

Duration: 1 hour
Location: DRIPPING SPRINGS

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, additional dates and private classes, contact training@ggroasting.com.

NOTE: This class is held in-person at our Dripping Springs Roastery. Public health and safety practices are carefully considered to allow participants to taste with reduced risk of cross-contamination. If you are experiencing any symptoms of COVID-19, please do not attend. By registering for this course, you are acknowledging all risk involved.

products.title: Clever Dripper & Filters: Bundle
products.body_html:
If you're looking for a no-brainer brewing method, look no further than the full-immersion coffee maker! This dripper combines the full-bodiedness of a French press with the mess-free convenience of a drip machine - it's like the superhero of brewing methods! Just pop in a #4 filter, add your favorite coffee grounds, pour hot water, and let it do its magic. When it's done, just release the steeped coffee straight into your mug - no fuss, no muss! It's the perfect way to start your day with a smile. ﻿Filters included with purchase.

Clever Dripper Recipe

coffee: 22g

water: 330 ml

temp: 201F

  • Add 330ml water, then grounds (to help with draw down time)
  • Start timer, and then gently push the grounds down to fully submerge them
  • At 3:30, drain, pour into a cup and enjoy!

products.title: Classes Gift Card
products.body_html:
Give the gift of learning! Choose a class you'd like to give to a friend and they can use it to pick the date/time that they'd prefer! Not to mention, on any coffee as well if some is left over!

Choose between:

  • Intro To Espresso
  • Cupping
  • Intro to Latte Art

The displayed price is per person. Class purchases must be made online. All classes are held at our Dripping Springs location.

products.title: Intro to Latte Art
products.body_html:
Learn how to steam milk and pour simple latte art! We'll go over proper steaming technique and pouring mechanics, with plenty of hands-on practice and assistance from the instructor. Most students will leave with the ability to pour a heart. 

This class is designed for the beginner home barista. Limit 6 students per class. Looking for something more advanced? Check out our Latte Art Workshop!

Duration: 1.5 hours
Location: Dripping Springs

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, contact training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Latte Art Workshop
products.body_html:
Step up your latte art in this interactive 2-hour intensive with head trainer and tulip-slinging barista, Marcos! We'll focus on proper techniques for tulips, rosettas, swans, and beyond, with plenty of hands-on practice and personalized feedback. 

Note: This class is designed for folks with an understanding of proper milk steaming technique. If you've never steamed milk, or if you're not super confident, try our Intro to Latte Art class! 

Limit 4 students per class. All materials are provided, but feel free to bring your own pitcher! 

Duration: 2 hours
Location: Dripping Springs

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. Schedule your class, training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Intro to Espresso
products.body_html:
Learn how to put your home espresso machine to work in this hands-on workshop in Dripping Springs. You'll learn how to select beans for espresso, prepare a perfect shot, adjust grind settings, and troubleshoot common home espresso machine issues. 

This class is designed for the beginner home barista. Limit 6 students per class. 

Duration: 1.5 hours
Location: DRIPPING SPRINGS

Classes are non-refundable. Discounts are available for baristas and other hospitality professionals. For more information, contact training@ggroasting.com.

products.title: Private Group Cupping
products.body_html:
This session will be held in person at our Dripping Springs Roastery. 

Choose a date and bring up to 12 friends to taste coffee like the professionals do! After a long season apart, there's nothing like sharing the joy of smells and tastes with your favorite people. In the specialty coffee industry, we call this sensory calibration. 

You'll try multiple coffees side by side and learn variations by origin, process, and roast profile. Using the official coffee flavor wheel, you’ll identify tasting notes and distinguish differences in aroma, body, sweetness, and acidity. 

This class utilizes a modified and highly accessible cupping guide and protocol. Public health and safety practices are carefully considered to allow participants to taste with reduced risk of cross-contamination. If you are not feeling well prior to your session, please contact us and we will gladly reschedule.

Includes 10% off retail bagged coffee.

Duration: 1 hour
Location: DRIPPING SPRINGS

For additional dates and custom classes, contact training@ggroasting.com

products.title: GG x Fellow Carter Slide Mug
products.body_html:
Indulge your inner plant parent with this GG Carter Move Mug with a slide lid. Artwork by Andrew Reiland. 

  • 12-ounce
  • BPA-free plastic lid
  • Heat-lock double-wall vacuum insulation
  • Keeps beverages hot or cold for 6 hours
  • Ceramic interior
  • Slide-lock lid
  • Fits in most car cup holders
  • Hand wash only

products.title: GG x Fellow Carter Move Mug
products.body_html:
Move it and reuse it with these custom GG Fellow Carter Move Mugs! Our flagship cafe was hand-drawn by Melissa Kuo. 

  • 12-ounce
  • BPA-free plastic lid
  • Heat-lock double-wall vacuum insulation
  • Keeps beverages hot or cold for 3 hours
  • Snap-in magnetic splash guard
  • Ceramic interior
  • Lid open on all sides allows drinking from any angle and aroma appreciation
  • Fits in most car cup holders
  • Hand wash only

products.title: Origami Sensory Cup
products.body_html:
The ORIGAMI Sensory Cup is designed to maximize the sensory experience. Its specially designed shape retains and captures the aroma of the coffee inside the cup.

This sensory cup is a collaboration between ORIGAMI JAPAN and World Brewer's Cup Champion Du Jianing, imported by Slow Pour Supply. Made in Japan with Minoware porcelain. 360ml / 12oz in volume.

products.title: Origami Air Dripper S
products.body_html:
The Small Origami Dripper puts the FUN in functional - but this time, it's shatterproof! The Air S is made with a styrene-acrylonitrile copolymer that is resistant to boiling water, and therefore dishwasher friendly. The series comes in a variety of translucent and lively colors with a frosted finish. These AS drippers are a representation of the beloved original Origami series.

Don't forget the filters! 

*Silicone holder sold separately.
